tiers.title: Prayer Overheads
notes: Blue dragons are weak to water spells and can easily be safespotted in <Link="Taverley_Dungeon">Taverley Dungeon</Link>.
Using the chaos altar in the wilderness will drastically speed up the process to unlock overheads, requiring less than 100 dragon bones.

tiers.title: Barbarian Assault
notes: The Fighter Torso is less important now with the addition of Moons armour. Many players dislike Barbarian Assault and if you are one of them feel free to skip this grind.

tiers.title: Chivalry
notes: If you previously leveled hunter via <Link="Hunters'_Rumours">Hunters' Rumours</Link>, then you should have a lot of <Link="Blessed_bone_shards">Blessed bone shards</Link> to help train prayer to 60.

tiers.title: Black Mask
notes: The Black Mask should be used anytime you are on a slayer task otherwise you use your normal helm.

tiers.title: Barrows
notes: Upcoming grinds will benefit from having tank armour. At a minimum you want to get tank legs since that slot is harder to acquire strength bonus.

Other items to look out for are Karil's and Ahrim's for non-melee combat styles. A <Link="Karil's_leathertop">Karil's Leathertop</Link> is particularly useful for its magic defence bonus and is sometimes used with melee setups.

tiers.title: Dagannoth Kings
notes: The only Dagannoth King worth killing right now is <Link="Dagannoth_Rex">Dagannoth Rex</Link>. The other kings are harder to kill for which the rings are very marginal upgrades.
A Dagannoth slayer task will make this easier if you have a <Link="Black_mask_(i)">Black Mask (i)</Link> but is not needed.

tiers.title: Royal Titans
notes: Royal Titans does not provide any upgrades for your melee setup but the upgraded prayers will be best in slot for a long time and increase DPS for future bosses.

tiers.title: Piety
notes: After having completed the Moons of Peril grind, you should have a lot of <Link="Blessed_bone_shards">Blessed bone shards</Link> and <Link="Sun-kissed_bones">Sun-kissed bones</Link> to help train prayer to 70.

tiers.title: Arclight
notes: The Arclight is an important <Link="Demon_(attribute)">Demonbane</Link> weapon that will be used for several upcoming monsters.

tiers.title: Demonic Gorillas
notes: It is usually best to craft a <Link="Necklace_of_anguish">Necklace of Anguish</Link> first but you will eventually need an Amulet of Torture to upgrade to <Link="Amulet_of_rancour">Amulet of Rancour</Link>.

tiers.title: Abyssal Sire
notes: The upgrades to your stab and crush setups are relatively small and will be replaced with better items later so feel free to skip Abyssal Sire.

tiers.title: General Graardor
notes: Bandos armour is the same strength bonus as Blood Moon but it has a lot more defence. It is not strictly needed and probably not worth farming without a Bowfa, but you will eventually need it to repair Torva.
The Bandos Godsword is a defence-draining spec weapon that is used at a lot of bosses. This is a very useful weapon to have before raiding.

tiers.title: K'ril Tsutsaroth
notes: It is not recommended to kill this boss right now without a <Link="Scorching_bow">Scorching Bow</Link> unless you are in a group.
The Zamorakian Hasta is a great stab weapon for Tombs of Amascut and is eventually needed to create a <Link="Dragon_hunter_lance">Dragon Hunter Lance</Link>.

tiers.title: Tombs of Amascut
notes: We are not looking to farm all of the items from the raid right now, just a few upgrades. The <Link="Osmumten's_fang">Osmumten's Fang</Link> is a very powerful weapon for general bossing.
The <Link="Lightbearer">Lighbearer</Link> regens special attack energy twice as fast which increases overall DPS for many bosses.
The <Link="Divine_rune_pouch">Divine Rune Pouch</Link> is important to maximize inventory space and is utilized at almost every boss.

tiers.title: Doom of Mokhaiotl
notes: Doom is a difficult boss but if you are an experienced player it may be worth grinding now so you can upgrade the boots as you receive drops from Cerberus. It is not strictly required at this time, however.

tiers.title: Cerberus
notes: If you did not previously farm Doom, then the <Link="Primordial_boots">Primordial Boots</Link> will be your best in slot.

tiers.title: Chambers of Xeric
notes: We are only doing Chambers of Xeric for the prayer scrolls to start sending Inferno attempts. The rest of the items will be farmed later, but if you happen to spoon an item then great!

tiers.title: Ultor Ring
notes: Vardorvis should be your main priority of the Desert Treasure II bosses. The <Link="Ultor_ring">Ultor Ring</Link> is the biggest DPS increase across all of the rings.

tiers.title: Soulreaper Axe
notes: The Soulreaper Axe is a very powerful weapon but it takes a long time to grind. It's a good alternative to the <Link="Scythe_of_vitur">Scythe of Vitur</Link> if you don't plan on farming Theatre of Blood anytime soon.

tiers.title: CoX: Challenge Mode
notes: At this point in your gear progression, you should be strong enough to do Challenge Mode for a better chance at uniques.

Both the Dragon Claws and Elder Maul are best in slot at many bosses across the game, but the Elder Maul is one of 3 very rare drops. The <Link="Dragon_warhammer">Dragon Warhammer</Link> is still a very strong alternative in the meantime.

tiers.title: Theatre of Blood
notes: A lot of our best in slot weapons are 2h so we don't prioritize Avernic Defender sooner, but if you'd like you can do a little bit of Theatre of Blood earlier in your progression since it is the most common drop.

tiers.title: Nex
notes: Torva armour gives higher max hits but Oathplate is still better DPS for slash because of its accuracy bonus, thus Torva should be used for non-slash attack styles.

tiers.title: Nightmare
notes: The Inquisitor's mace is best in slot for crush on 1x1 monsters otherwise the Scythe is still better.
Inquisitor's armour is pretty niche and not worth farming as part of normal progression. It is only good for the crush attack style in a few situations.
